alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Houston; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 19 at 9:50PM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...High Impact Winter Storm Still Looking Likely... .A major winter storm is expected to impact the central part of the country late this week. This storm is expected to produce heavy snow and high winds that will create blowing snow and possibly blizzard conditions. Arctic air spreading in with and behind the storm will also create bitterly to dangerously cold wind chills. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches possible through Thursday with additional accumulations through Friday night likely. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes starting Thursday morning. Strong winds and additional snowfall could cause tree damage and power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If you have travel plans ahead of the Christmas weekend, consider altering or delaying them if possible.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Dodge; Fillmore; Houston; Mower; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona
